title: Far from crash, talk on AI ‘just getting started’ in India: Netweb CMD
snippet: Netweb Technologies earned  ₹450 crore from a government contract last quarter. CMD Sanjay Lodha believes demand for sovereign AI will sustain for five years. While investors are largely bullish, concerns remain around flat margins and Netweb's sole focus on AI.

title: Korea Kicks Off AI Squid Game in Bid to Compete with US, China
snippet: The state-backed survival contest aims to find the best indigenous AI models.

title: WhatsApp Web update may narrow the gap with mobile and desktop apps: Here's how
snippet: WhatsApp is reportedly working on group voice and video calling for its web platform, alongside call links and scheduling features. The update could bring bring WhatsApp Web closer to the mobile and desktop experience, offering more flexibility across devices.

title: iPhone 18 series tipped to debut LTPO+ displays and under-display face ID
snippet: Apple’s iPhone 18 series could debut advanced LTPO+ displays with improved efficiency and brightness, alongside under-display Face ID that may replace the Dynamic Island, signalling one of the biggest visual upgrades to Apple’s iPhones in years.

title: Lava Blaze Duo 3 launched with 50MP Sony camera and 33W fast charging: Price and features
snippet: Lava Blaze Duo 3 has launched in India with a unique dual display design, featuring a rear AMOLED screen, a 120Hz front AMOLED panel, MediaTek Dimensity 7060 chipset, 50MP Sony camera and a 5,000mAh battery with 33W fast charging.

title: AI became democratic, its future to be written in big cities and small places: Nasscom director

title: Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra tipped to arrive in four colours including blue and violet
snippet: Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra colour options have surfaced online, revealing black, white, blue and violet shades ahead of a rumoured February launch. The leak also hints at subtle design changes and a revised camera layout for Samsung’s next flagship.

title: Realme P4 Power 5G tipped to feature 10,000mAh battery and 144Hz AMOLED display
snippet: Realme P4 Power 5G is set to launch in India soon, with its Flipkart microsite now live. The phone is expected to feature a 144Hz AMOLED display, a 10,000mAh battery with 80W fast charging, and a MediaTek Dimensity chipset.

title: Amazon Great Republic Day Sale 2026 brings big savings on GPS smartwatches
snippet: The Amazon Sale 2026 is live, offering strong deals on GPS smartwatches from brands like Samsung, Amazfit, Garmin and more, along with bank offers, no-cost EMI options, and cashback that make fitness-focused wearables more affordable.

title: Republic Day to lift ecommerce sales; Shadowfax nets anchor funds
snippet: Happy Tuesday! Ecommerce sales are set to rise during this year’s Republic Day sale season. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

title: Indians face more US visa refusals on social media scrutiny
snippet: Indians are facing increasing temporary US visa refusals under section 221(g), with stricter background checks, social media vetting, and scrutiny of old arrest records causing delays. Even applicants with valid documents are affected, and appointments are being pushed to later in the year. The proc

title: LTIMindtree suffers 12% fall in Q3 net profit, at Rs 959 crore
snippet: LTI Mindtree reported an 11.7% drop in net profit for September–December, impacted by one-off labour code implementation expenses. Revenue grew 11.6% year-on-year in December, supported by strong deals and AI demand. The company aims to double revenue in five years, focusing on growth and market pos

title: Travel firms tune into AI tech big time
snippet: Indians are increasingly turning to AI platforms for personalised travel planning, and online travel platforms are rushing to tap into this opportunity. title: Rise in contract value for top IT firms signals stronger deal pipeline
snippet: India’s top IT firms showed mixed Q3 results, with Infosys, HCLTech and Tech Mahindra posting strong deal growth, signalling improving demand. title: AI is writing your travel diaries
snippet: AI travel influencers are here, can they coexist with human creators? ET finds out.

snippet: Artificial intelligence is redrawing the skills map for India’s $280 billion IT services industry, and unless professionals upskill at speed, job disruption could be severe, said AI pioneer Andrew Ng, founder of DeepLearning.AI and cofounder of Coursera. title: Ecommerce platforms may post 20-22% growth in Republic Day sales
snippet: Ecommerce marketplaces such as Amazon India and Flipkart are set to post 20–22% growth during their ongoing Republic Day sales compared with last year, extending the online shopping momentum seen during the 2025 festive season, according to industry experts.
